notesStmt.note: Has lacunae after folios: 10, 17, 21, 25, 26, 31, 46, 47, 50, 54. Partially water-damaged. Several stains.

Folios 1r-2v and 56r-57v contain a notarial instrument of Bertrand de Rua of Toulouse, regarding debts held by various people towards Master Salomon Mosse, dated 7 December 1383 and 3 June 1383 respectively. Elia Lattas: inscribed with a date of 17 August 1590, folio 3r. Fr. Alexander Longus Inquisitore de Montis regalis: inscribed, folio 3r.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A fragment of an anonymous commentary on the Former Prophets.

collation.p: Irregular number of leaves in the quire. Folios 1-2 and 56-57 constitute one large folio each, folded in two.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi (Provencal) semi-cursive script, unpunctuated, of 14th century.

history.provenance: Acquisition: M. Asher: purchased by the British Museum from him on 24 May 1857: inscribed [58v].
